results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: Meal planning and recipe database for a meal kit delivery service tracking nutritional information, costs, ratings, dietary attributes, and operational details
key_data_points: 1,901 total ratings for Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
Multiple recipe variants (A-F) for same meal

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Graveyard status meal with multiple variants (F00002A-F), last ran 2023-W49, marked as Calorie Smart, High Protein, Dairy Free

entities.name: Greek Isle Caper Salmon & Polenta
entities.context: New meal (F01905A) with 3.53 rating, $3.69 cost, marked for GLP-1 Balance and Mediterranean diet

entities.name: Greek-Style Market Chicken Bowl
entities.context: New meal (F01906A) with shredded chicken, $2.62 cost, GLP-1 Support and Mediterranean attributes

entities.name: Red Pepper Bruschetta Shredded Chicken
entities.context: New meal (F01907A) with $2.36 cost, Italian cuisine, dairy-free option

entities.name: Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef
entities.context: New meal (F01908A) with beef, $2.85 cost, European-Italian cuisine

insights: Multiple recipe variants exist for the same meal name with slight cost and nutritional variations
Graveyard status indicates discontinued or phased-out recipes
Strong focus on dietary categorization: Keto, Calorie Smart, High Protein, GLP-1 Balance, Mediterranean, etc.
Operational tracking includes cook methods (Grill, Oven, Braiser), container types, and sleeve colors
Cost management is critical with actual costs compared against max meal cost targets
New meals are in 'Pending' shelf life status with approval dates around 10/21/2025
European-Italian cuisine is dominant in the sample
Protein type and preparation method are key classification dimensions
Nutrition scores range from 0-4.125 with dietary fiber content tracked separately

results.purpose: Internal marketing performance tracker for Good Chop, tracking weekly metrics and week-over-week (WoW) changes
key_data_points: Tracking spans approximately 3+ years of marketing data

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Company being tracked in the marketing performance spreadsheet

entities.name: David Sternberg
entities.context: Director of Product Design at HelloFresh departing after 5.5 years, mentioned in email content

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Company referenced in farewell emails, appears unrelated to Good Chop tracker

entities.name: Utorics Institute
entities.context: David Sternberg's next destination for cognitive quantum-behaviour research

insights: Spreadsheet structure shows systematic weekly tracking with WoW comparisons introduced midway through 2022
Data spans from 2021 (W30) through mid-2024 (24-W28), indicating long-term marketing performance monitoring
Limited actual data visible in spreadsheet content - mostly header structure with one data point for 'Self-Improvement' category
Email content appears to be accidentally included and is unrelated to Good Chop marketing tracker
The tracker likely contains multiple marketing metrics across various categories, though most data cells are not visible in the extract

results.purpose: Consumer product tribe roadmap tracking initiatives, priorities, delivery timelines, and capacity planning across multiple squads (Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, Consumer Foundations)
key_data_points: Domain Objective: 'Ignite Daily Engagement to Fuel Our New Growth Engine'
Domain Objective: 'Evolve Loyalty to Reward A Long-Lasting Relationship & Engagement, Not Just Transactions'
Domain Objective: 'Build a Foundation for Speed & Flexibility'
Key metrics tracked: DAU/MAU ratio, weekly recipe engagement, cookbook visits, opt-in rates, reward redemption rates, AOR (Average Order Rate)
Dependencies noted: Shopping Experience, Communications/Iterable, Localization Platform Roll-out (Q4 2025)
Capacity planning includes: BE, RN, Web, iOS, Android resource allocation

entities.name: E06 - Inspire Squad
entities.context: Engagement tribe squad focused on recipe discovery, import experience, cookbook features, and in-kitchen utilities

entities.name: E09 - Missions Squad
entities.context: Loyalty & Virality tribe squad working on Loyalty Hub entry points and Loyalty 2.0 MVP Milestone 1

entities.name: E10 - Rewards Squad
entities.context: Loyalty & Virality tribe squad delivering Loyalty 2.0 MVP Milestone 2 with tiers and integration

entities.name: E05 - Client Platform Squad
entities.context: Consumer Foundations tribe squad handling Snowplow migration

entities.name: Discovery Hub
entities.context: New feature for curated content to drive recipe discovery and solve 'inspiration paralysis'

entities.name: Recipe Hub
entities.context: Existing system with search and filtering tools for recipes

entities.name: Cookbook
entities.context: Core feature being enhanced with improved access, navigation, and utility features

entities.name: Loyalty 2.0
entities.context: Major program overhaul with 'Earn & Burn' points system, reward store, and tiered benefits launching Feb-Mar 2025

entities.name: HelloFresh app
entities.context: Primary mobile application being enhanced across all initiatives

entities.name: Snowplow
entities.context: Analytics platform migration in progress

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Leader discussing CS5 role opening, Spur tool procurement, and refund tracking issues

entities.name: Beatrice Dimarucut
entities.context: Being mentored for CS5 role, working on charge-at-checkout refunds and owl issues

entities.name: Kag
entities.context: Person to consult regarding refund and cancellation tracking in AL system

entities.name: Spur
entities.context: Competitive analysis tool for tracking and comparing flows, financially approved for procurement

insights: Heavy focus on engagement and retention through recipe discovery and cookbook features in Q1 2025
Loyalty program undergoing major transformation from transactional to relationship-based model with two-phase MVP rollout (Feb-Mar 2025)
Information Architecture changes removing Loyalty from navigation bar creating risk of reduced awareness - mitigation strategies being implemented
Recipe import and cookbook features prioritized to convert passive saving into active cooking sessions
Cross-squad dependencies exist between Engagement and Shopping Experience, and Loyalty with Communications/Iterable
Confidence levels vary significantly: Recipe Import (High confidence), Cookbook Access (Medium), In-Kitchen Utilities (Low confidence)
Refund processing timeline identified as problematic (one week too long) requiring separate tracking for refunded customers
Team capacity planning spans multiple platforms (Backend, React Native, Web, iOS, Android) indicating full-stack initiatives
20% capacity ringfenced for maintaining base version of loyalty program while building 2.0
Career development and team restructuring happening with CS5 role opening following Dio's departure
